posts.post_content: This guy's under Gideon Jura's tutelage in Sideburnomancy. Great for saving your creatures from infect. Or use this on Corpse Cur to keep getting your dead infectors back. I mean if you make everything unblockable and infect the hell out of the opponent so easily with his second ability which is just so.... \*shudders in pleasure\*

posts.post_content: He is also a source of "extra" mana in the sense that he can flicker a land after you've tapped out and it will reenter the battlefield untapped, allowing you to play instants on your opponents turn. It has been really helpful to me when I tap out for a Precursor golem and need one mana open to play apostle's blessing.

posts.post_content:
There are a few uses for Venser that I don't think I've seen here. Of course there's the obvious CIP triggers, cleansing poison counters, reclaiming the [Jace, the Mind Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace, the Mind Sculptor) your opponent just stole with [Volition Reins](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Volition Reins), etc. The first is resetting cumulative upkeep. [Illusionary Terrain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Illusionary Terrain) goes from "decent stall card" to "instant scoop" against a lot of decks if you get a Venser down with it. The second is disabling any double-edged sword cards you have. Suddenly, [Standstill](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Standstill) is even crazier than before, and the aforementioned Illusionary Terrain will work even if your opponent's playing blue. And then just the miscellaneous shenanigans you can pull with things like [Ancestral Knowledge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ancestral Knowledge).  
  
You could also pull off a lot of these combos with [Vedalken Mastermind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vedalken Mastermind), but Venser has a few advantages: he's much harder to kill/bounce, you don't have to recast af... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
There are a few uses for Venser that I don't think I've seen here. Of course there's the obvious CIP triggers, cleansing poison counters, reclaiming the Jace, the Mind Sculptor your opponent just stole with Volition Reins, etc. The first is resetting cumulative upkeep. Illusionary Terrain goes from "decent stall card" to "instant scoop" against a lot of decks if you get a Venser down with it. The second is disabling any double-edged sword cards you have. Suddenly, Standstill is even crazier than before, and the aforementioned Illusionary Terrain will work even if your opponent's playing blue. And then just the miscellaneous shenanigans you can pull with things like Ancestral Knowledge.

You could also pull off a lot of these combos with Vedalken Mastermind, but Venser has a few advantages: he's much harder to kill/bounce, you don't have to recast af... (see all)

Posted By: Lyoncet (6/11/2011 12:08:46 PM)

posts.post_content:
Venser is probably the only one who can use his first ability to 'cleanse' -1/-1 counters of your creatures, a great deal consider that you don't see many cards that can do this.
  
   
And here's a possible combo for Elspeth Tirel and Venser working together, with Elspeth creating tokens the first time in the turn, then let Venser exile her, returning her with 4 loyalty couners again. You can keep doing this each turn till you're satisfied withthe number of soldier tokens at your command, and they also act as your shield against constant harassment, three soldiers each turn to block your opponent's desperate assault.
  
   
When you felt you had enough, proliferate or wait a turn for Elspeth to charge up, have Venser phase himself out of the game before letting Elspeth clean the board, while he comes back with his 3 counters. Sound strategy, bet most players didn't think of that but it works.
  
   
Oh, and um, Bathory, care to explain your issues with 'arms'? '''>\_>'''
  
(lol)
posts.html:
Venser is probably the only one who can use his first ability to 'cleanse' -1/-1 counters of your creatures, a great deal consider that you don't see many cards that can do this.

And here's a possible combo for Elspeth Tirel and Venser working together, with Elspeth creating tokens the first time in the turn, then let Venser exile her, returning her with 4 loyalty couners again. You can keep doing this each turn till you're satisfied withthe number of soldier tokens at your command, and they also act as your shield against constant harassment, three soldiers each turn to block your opponent's desperate assault.

When you felt you had enough, proliferate or wait a turn for Elspeth to charge up, have Venser phase himself out of the game before letting Elspeth clean the board, while he comes back with his 3 counters. Sound strategy, bet most players didn't think of that but it works.

Oh, and um, Bathory, care to explain your issues with 'arms'? '''>_>'''
(lol)

I recently played against a guy who used his flicker ability with Stonehorn Dignitary. Never having a combat phase really destroy's an deck that uses combat to deal damage.

@Mechakraken

The text on Venser says "Exile Target Permanent." A card is not a permanent until it is on the battlefield. Even if you own it. Even so, if Phage comes into play anyway other than you casting her, you lose, so you couldn't flicker her.

posts.post_content:
Venser, is my favorite mutli-colored Plainswalker because of 5 reasons...  
  
1. UW Infect decks have an end game using his middle ability when you have 10 power amongst your creatures.  
2. Ally decks have a way to reuse there effects.  
3. UW Proliferate Decks have an a insane way to exile cards.  
4. The insane morph combos he creates is evil.  
5. Finally resets \*\*\*ulative upkeep for your cards.

posts.post_content:
@Splizer: Emblems are "Once an emblem has been generated, it's generated for the entirety of the current game" and they cannot be regenerated or formed again once it's already there. Thus, having multiple Vensers/deck for the sake of using his ultimate would only be useful if you were unable to get his ultimate off while he was previously in play. (FYI).  
  
How is Vensy not a $30+ P-Walker??
posts.html:
@Splizer: Emblems are "Once an emblem has been generated, it's generated for the entirety of the current game" and they cannot be regenerated or formed again once it's already there.
